title: Half-Life 2 Episode Two for Mac
description:
Half-Life 2 Episode Two for MAC.
Known bugs/issues:
After application launch in main menu mouse doest work, change any graphic settings - mouse works, or just load a game. Use directional keys, tab and enter to get to configure dialog(Yeah remember the past times without mouse controller).
Settings are not saved, every time you need to apply them again from begining.Savegames are saved normaly.
Some graphics issues - such a not working HDR(or working with a ugly sky bug) and very small draw distance, so some objects may disappear from view but exist in game world, just come closer.
Some textures are not rendered correctly.
==[SysRq]==
* Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard
* Intel Core Duo or Core 2 Duo Processor 
* 1024 MB RAM 
* ATI X1600 or NVIDIA 7300 GT with 128 MB of Video RAM
Supported Video Cards 
NVIDIA GeForce series 
7300, 7600, 8600, 8800 
ATI Radeon series 
X1600, X1900, HD 2400, HD 2600 
Intel Extreme Graphics GMA X3100

This game will not run on the GMA 950 class of integrated video cards.

For computers using built-in graphics chipsets, the game requires at least: 
* Intel Integrated Chipset GMA X3100 
* Dual 2.0GHz CPUs, or 1.7GHz Core 2 Duo, or equivalent 

After launching application you notice that mouse is not working correctly and video settings are not saved. Spent 2 minutes for adjusting settings.
Use directional keys, tab and enter to get to options and change any graphics settings in advanced, apply, after game finishes mouse will work.
You also can load the savegame - in game mouse will work correctly.
Do not turn on HDR it will cause some graphics artefacts.
